public int ResetTimer = 0;

item.title: I Need A Auto-Restarter
item.dc:creator: @yppman yppman
item.description:
@yppman wrote:

[quote=“r1ch kid, post:7, topic:103351”][code]// This resets server every 30 mins to stop lag - xerozcheez
import java.io.*;

public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“RESETING SERVER!!!”);
misc.println(“Saving all games…”);
PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
misc.println(“GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS”);
ResetTimer = 0;
closeListener();
runserver();
}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 99999999)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void runserver()
{
try
{
String run = “runserver.bat”;
String xstr = “./”+run;
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
}
catch (IOException ioe)
{
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
}

public void closeListener()
{
try {
server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
if(server.clientListener != null) server.clientListener.close();
server.clientListener = null;
}
catch(java.lang.Exception __ex)
{
__ex.printStackTrace();
}
}
}[/code]

thats your anti lag/auto restarter change the 99999999 to watever its in seconds[/quote]
Atually it’s not seconds, but half seconds. The code that counts the time and changes the int is called every 500ms by your server.java

And for my rebooter, I got automate 6 and made a rebooter for it. I’ll attach the task file for you if you happen to get automate.[br][size=1]Posted on: June 02, 2007, 01:24:42 AM[/size][hr]Here, just import it if you get automate, and change server window names, runserver.bat path etc in editor. Btw had to zip because it was unallowed file extension.

Read full topic

item.title: I Need A Auto-Restarter
item.dc:creator: @r1ch_kid r1ch kid
item.description:
@r1ch_kid wrote:

[code]// This resets server every 30 mins to stop lag - xerozcheez
import java.io.*;

public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“RESETING SERVER!!!”);
misc.println(“Saving all games…”);
PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
misc.println(“GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS”);
ResetTimer = 0;
closeListener();
runserver();
}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 99999999)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void runserver()
{
try
{
String run = “runserver.bat”;
String xstr = “./”+run;
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
}
catch (IOException ioe)
{
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
}

public void closeListener()
{
try {
server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
if(server.clientListener != null) server.clientListener.close();
server.clientListener = null;
}
catch(java.lang.Exception __ex)
{
__ex.printStackTrace();
}
}
}[/code]

thats your anti lag/auto restarter change the 99999999 to watever its in seconds

[quote=“dbmain, post:4, topic:103351”]a quick way to fix that make shure you go threw your client.java and search for thingls like …

playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("
thing like that thoes are quick back doors to your server i know because i do that all the time to my sources.
but to make it so you are all ways a admin search for
bankItemsN = loadgame.bankItemsN;
playerLevel = loadgame.playerLevel;
playerXP = loadgame.playerXP;
that is the way it is for myn and after the two }'s hit enter and add in …
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“your username goes here.”) && playerPass.equalsIgnoreCase(“password goes here”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}[/quote]

Wtf? Nice auto-restarter…
